title: New details confirm a deliberate drone crash on critical US power grid
description: A drone that crashed near a critical power substation was likely meant to damage or disrupt the infrastructure, according to a federal law enforcement bulletin obtained by CNN. Alex Marquardt reports.

title: CNN reporter fact-checks Biden after he calls a report 'garbage'
description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks President Biden about a Wall Street Journal report that said the Biden administration is considering financial settlements for families separated at the border.

title: Glenn Close reveals changed view on 'Fatal Attraction' to Anderson Cooper
description: Actor Glenn Close speaks with CNN's Anderson Cooper about how her perspective on mental health has changed since playing her iconic role in "Fatal Attraction" at Citizen by CNN. Get Citizen by CNN updates about exclusive events and tools delivered to your inbox weekly.

title: Ethiopian rebels have edged closer to Addis Ababa. Here's what you need to know about the conflict
description: When Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2019, he was lauded as a regional peacemaker. Now, he is presiding over a protracted civil war that by many accounts bears the hallmarks of genocide and has the potential to destabilize the wider Horn of Africa region.

title: Element found in our teeth detected for the first time in galaxy 12 billion light-years away
description: For the first time, astronomers have detected fluorine, which can be found in our bones and teeth as fluoride, in a galaxy that is more than 12 billion light-years away.

title: Chinese tennis star accuses former top Communist Party leader of sexual assault, triggering blanket censorship
OPEC under pressure to pump more oil as gas prices soar
description: Even as the world debates the end of fossil fuels at COP26 in Glasgow, OPEC and its allies are discussing whether to pump more oil to tame soaring energy prices that are fueling global inflation and hurting vulnerable households.

title: This Virginia Democrat thinks Biden fundamentally misunderstood his mandate
Whoever buys Prince Charles' former $6.7 million country estate must be prepared for a royal drop-in
description: A country estate in southwest England is up for sale for £4.95 million ($6.7 million), and the new owners could be obliged to receive a royal visitor at short notice.

title: Federal judge skeptical of Trump's efforts to block release of presidential documents
description: The power Donald Trump holds as a former president will be put to the test on Thursday, as a federal judge is set to hear arguments on whether Trump can keep secret records from his White House about his attempt to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Paul Newman tells his own story in newly discovered memoir
description: A newly discovered memoir by late Hollywood legend Paul Newman, in which he talks about fame, marriage and aging gracefully, is to be published next year, publishers Knopf said on Wednesday.

title: Europe facing 500,000 more Covid deaths by February, WHO warns
South Taurids 2021: Meteor shower peaks Thursday night
description: The meteor shower is known for fireballs, extra bright meteors that shoot across the sky.

title: Europe is facing a potentially devastating winter that could see half a million people die with Covid-19, the World Health Organization warns
description: Europe is facing a potentially devastating winter that could see half a million people die with Covid-19, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Thursday, as it sounded the alarm over a surge in cases and bemoaned stuttering vaccination rollouts on parts of the continent.

title: Google celebrates Diwali with Easter egg
description: As people around the world begin to celebrate Diwali, Google is commemorating the event with a special Easter egg.

title: South African author Damon Galgut wins Booker Prize
description: South African author and playwright Damon Galgut won the Booker Prize on Wednesday for his novel "The Promise," about a White family's failed commitment to give their Black maid her own home.

title: Juror in Rittenhouse trial dismissed for joke about police shooting of Jacob Blake
description: A juror was dismissed in Kyle Rittenhouse's homicide trial Thursday morning after he told a joke to a deputy earlier this week about the police shooting of Jacob Blake.

title: Russian analyst who was source for Steele dossier arrested and charged with lying to FBI
description: Igor Danchenko, a Russian analyst who was a source for the 2016 dossier of allegations about Donald Trump, was arrested Thursday as part of Special Counsel John Durham's investigation into the origins of the FBI's Russia investigation, a law enforcement official told CNN.

title: Opinion: American democracy will only be safe if a universal truth is reached
description: We are in the era of disinformation.

title: Marie Antoinette's diamond bracelets expected to fetch up to $4 million at auction
description: Diamond bracelets that belonged to Marie Antoinette and a ruby and diamond bangle offered to the Duchess of Windsor by her husband on their first wedding anniversary will be on the auction block in Geneva next week, Christie's said on Wednesday.

title: Hear the moment 4-year-old missing girl was rescued
description: Police in Western Australia have released a recording of the moment Cleo Smith was found. The toddler went missing from a campsite on October 16 and was rescued this week after a highly publicized search.

title: Royal jewels smuggled out of Russia during 1917 revolution go on sale
description: Russian royal jewels smuggled out of the country during the 1917 revolution, alongside rare colored diamonds, are on offer at auction next week in Geneva, looking for deep-pocketed collectors emerging from the pandemic.

title: Identifying 'habitable worlds' is a top priority for astronomers in the decade ahead
description: It's quite a large to-do list.

title: Boris Johnson's government in fresh swirl of murk and sleaze accusations
description: Boris Johnson's government is mired in allegations of sleaze.

title: Cricketer Gary Ballance admits using racial slur towards former Yorkshire teammate Azeem Rafiq
description: Cricketer Gary Ballance has admitted that he used a racial slur towards ex-Yorkshire teammate Azeem Rafiq and that he regrets doing so.

title: 'The Harder They Fall's' sweet tribute to Chadwick Boseman
description: "The Harder They Fall" has a scene which honors the late Chadwick Boseman.

title: Tesla owners say they are wowed -- and alarmed -- by 'full self-driving'
description: Drivers with Tesla's "full self-driving" software often don't know what their cars will do next.

title: Cuba is cracking down on critics. This unlikely dissident says he'll protest anyway
description: A skinny, bespectacled, left-leaning playwright whose works until recently were promoted by the government would seem an unlikely candidate to become Cuba's public enemy number one.

title: The era of free money is ending
description: For about 20 months, central banks have funneled an unprecedented amount of cash into the financial system, aiming to limit the worst effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on the economy. Now, with an eye on inflation, they're changing course — with big ramifications for stocks and bonds.

title: Harris looks to strengthen US-France ties in 'concrete ways' on Paris trip
description: Vice President Kamala Harris will pursue US efforts to strengthen a recently mended French-American relationship during a trip to Paris next week, where she will also attend a pair of international conferences.

title: UK becomes first country to authorize 'game changer' Covid pill
description:
• New US vaccine requirements to take effect January 4
• China doubles down on zero-Covid

title: 'The most shocking Holocaust item' was on auction. Auschwitz survivors are furious
description: Following an outcry from Holocaust survivors, an Israeli court has suspended the auction of a partial tattoo kit which is said to have been used on inmates at the Auschwitz death camp. CNN's Bianca Nobilo calls out the auction and shares a personal story on the Holocaust.

title: Nintendo says the chip shortage is hurting Switch sales
description: Nintendo has become the latest victim of a global chip shortage that is battering supply chains.

title: The world is not adapting fast enough to the climate crisis, UN reports
description: Despite countries taking steps to cut greenhouse gas emissions — steps researchers say aren't nearly strong enough to address the climate crisis — the gap is widening between climate impacts and the world's effort to adapt to them, according to a new report by the UN Environment Programme.

title: Satellite photos raise concerns of Russian military build-up near Ukraine
description: Once more, tensions are rising in Ukraine.

title: How Iceland could reshape the world of golf
description: Iceland may seem like an unlikely golfing power.

title: HPV vaccine reduced cervical cancer rates by 87% in women, UK study finds
description: The first generation HPV vaccine cut cervical cancer rates among women by 87%, British researchers reported.

title: New details emerge in the car crash related to geologist's disappearance
description: New details released by police shed more light on the car crash related to the disappearance of Daniel Robinson, the 24-year-old geologist who went missing after leaving a work site in the Arizona desert over the summer.

title: Man charged over abduction of 4-year-old Cleo Smith
Ultra long-haul flights from London to Sydney? They're still in the works, says Qantas CEO
description: As Australia reopens to international travel for the first time in nearly 20 months, resulting in some emotional reunions, the country's flag carrier is setting its sights on recovery.

title: The Indian billionaire vaccine prince whose plans went awry
description: As Covid-19 wreaked havoc around the world last year, the 39-year-old son of an Indian billionaire was laying the groundwork for a plan he hoped would eventually end the pandemic.

title: World's largest 3D-printed neighborhood to break ground in Texas
description: A new property development in Austin, Texas, is set to become the world's largest community of 3D-printed homes.

title: Iran releases footage of alleged incident with US navy
description: Iran has released video from an alleged clash with the US navy last month in the Gulf of Oman. Iran claims the US forces were attempting to board a tanker to confiscate Iranian crude oil. Pentagon spokesman John Kirby rejected the claims in a press conference.

title: China doubles down on zero-Covid
description: China is scrambling to contain its most widespread Covid-19 outbreak since the first wave of infections that began in Wuhan in 2019.

title: 'Rust' armorer's attorney floats sabotage theory. Hear ex-crew member's reaction
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo talks with Lane Luper, the A-camera first assistant on "Rust" who resigned from the production due to concerns about an unsafe work environment. Luper weighed in on an interview with the attorney for armorer Hannah Gutierrez Reed in which he theorized that someone "sabotaged" the set.

title: China's zero-case obsession has turned the country into a 'Covid purgatory'
description: While most regions across Asia Pacific have reopened and are living with the virus, China is doubling down on its strategy to fully eradicate the virus within its borders. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout has more.

title: 'Tiger King' Joe Exotic says he has been diagnosed with aggressive form of prostate cancer
description: Joseph Maldonado, known as Joe Exotic on the 2020 Netflix docuseries "Tiger King: Murder, Mayhem and Madness," has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer, according to a letter written by Maldonado.

title: Stella McCartney: Fashion industry is the most unfashionable for sustainability
description: British fashion designer Stella McCartney has long been ahead of the curve for sustainable fashion. She joins CNN's Bianca Nobilo from the COP26 climate conference in Glasgow, Scotland, on what she thinks should change in the highly polluting fashion industry.

title: Art installation creates optical illusions at Giza Pyramids
description: CNN's Becky Anderson speaks with curator Nadine Abdel Ghaffar about the "Forever is Now" art exhibition at the Giza Pyramids in Egypt.

title: Macaulay Culkin makes surprise runway appearance at star-studded Gucci show
description: Macaulay Culkin often shirks the spotlight, but he made a surprise appearance Tuesday as a runway model for Gucci.

title: Watch: 'The Masked Singer' reveals who's behind The Beach Ball
description: "The Masked Singer" pulled the cover off of the celebrity who's been inside a beach ball costume this season.

title: The next big thing in electric vehicles
description: In 1958, a now-iconic Rolls-Royce advert promised passengers that, despite its eight-cylinder aluminum engine, the loudest noise would be its electric clock.
